snippet: Families of the hostages held by a gunman who killed four people in a kosher supermarket in Paris in January are suing a French broadcaster, saying its live coverage endangered the hostages’ lives.
abstract: Families of hostages taken by gunman in shooting at kosher supermarket in Paris are suing French broadcaster BFM over live coverage that they say endangered lives; French prosecutors may also bring criminal charges against BFM.
lead_paragraph: Families of the hostages held by a gunman who killed four people in a kosher supermarket in Paris in January are suing a French broadcaster, saying its live coverage endangered the hostages’ lives.

headline.main: France: TV Reports on Hostage Taking Prompt Lawsuit and an Investigation
